info.title: IBM IoT Blockchain Trade Lane Sample Contract API
info.description: Interact with the API and schema for IoT trade lane sample contract. Based on the CRUD contract pattern, which is implemented as a pseudo-RPC payload in the chain code inputs (function string and args string array) of the deploy, invoke and query end points. Similar in concept to a JSON-RPC encoding. Note that the interface shown in this schema defines the chaincode inputs as an array of objects, but those objects are always in fact a single JSON encoded string. The sections before Definitions are redacted versions of the rest_api.json file in the Open Block Chain project. This schema builds on the paths by defining the payloads for the devops resource APIs. This file can be explored in the Swagger GUI, but it throws an error on the choice verb 'oneOf', which is very useful for defining payloads related to one endpoint, such as query. This schema uses references everywhere to avoid data duplication, but the generate command runs a script that can resolve all references and create a schema with all data fully realized.

post.description: The /chaincode endpoint receives requests to deploy, invoke, and query a target Chaincode. This service endpoint implements the JSON RPC 2.0 specification with the payload identifying the desired Chaincode operation within the 'method' property.

jsonrpc.description: A string specifying the version of the JSON-RPC protocol. Must be exactly '2.0'.

method.description: the command's service endpoint for deployment, invocation or query

params.description: A required Chaincode specification message identifying the target chaincode.

id.description: An integer number used to correlate the request and response objects. If it is not included, the request is assumed to be a notification and the server will not generate a response.

ctorMsg.description: Specific function to execute within the Chaincode.

path.description: Chaincode location in the file system. This value is required by the deploy transaction.

name.description: Chaincode name identifier. This value is required by the invoke and query transactions.

ChaincodeInput.description: the payload for a deploy, invoke or query message

ChaincodeInputDeploy.description: the payload for a deploy message

ChaincodeInputInvoke.description: the payload for an invoke message

ChaincodeInputQuery.description: the payload for a query message

Status.description: A string confirming successful request execution.

Message.description: Additional information about the response or values returned.

code.description: A number that indicates the error type that occurred.

message.description: A string providing a short description of the error.

data.default: Error unmarshalling chaincode request payload: unexpected end of JSON input
data.description: A primitive or structured value that contains additional information about the error (e.g. detailed error information, nested errors etc.).

API.description: The API for the tradelane sample contract consisting of the init function, the crud functions to change state, and a set of query functions for asset state, asset history, recent states, and so on.

init.description: Initializes the contract when started, either by deployment or by peer restart.

eventFlight.description: Post a flight event to the contract. One argument, a JSON encoded event. The 'assetID' property is the target for the event, which is an aircraft in the case of the flight event.

eventInspection.description: Post an inspection event to the contract. One argument, a JSON encoded event. The 'assetID' property is the target for the event, which is an assembly in the case of the inspection event.

eventAnalyticAdjustment.description: Post an analytic adjustment event to the contract. One argument, a JSON encoded event. The 'assetID' property is the target for the event, which is an assembly in the case of the analytic adjustment event.

eventMaintenance.description: Post a maintenance event to the contract. One argument, a JSON encoded event. The 'assetID' property is the target for the event, which is an assembly in the case of the maintenance event.

createAssetAirline.description: Create an airline asset. One argument, a JSON encoded event. The 'assetID' property is required with zero or more writable properties. Establishes an initial asset state.

createAssetAircraft.description: Create an aircraft asset. One argument, a JSON encoded event. The 'assetID' property is required with zero or more writable properties. Establishes an initial asset state.

createAssetAssembly.description: Create an assembly asset. One argument, a JSON encoded event. The 'assetID' property is required with zero or more writable properties. Establishes an initial asset state.

updateAssetAirline.description: Update the state of an airline asset. The one argument is a JSON encoded event. The 'assetID' property is required along with one or more writable properties. Establishes the next asset state.

updateAssetAircraft.description: Update the state of an aircraft asset. The one argument is a JSON encoded event. The 'assetID' property is required along with one or more writable properties. Establishes the next asset state.

updateAssetAssembly.description: Update the state of an assembly asset. The one argument is a JSON encoded event. The 'assetID' property is required along with one or more writable properties. Establishes the next asset state.

deleteAssetAirline.description: Delete an airline asset, its history, and any recent state activity. Argument is a JSON encoded string containing only an 'assetID'.

deleteAssetAircraft.description: Delete an aircraft asset, its history, and any recent state activity. Argument is a JSON encoded string containing only an 'assetID'.

deleteAssetAssembly.description: Delete an assembly asset, its history, and any recent state activity. Argument is a JSON encoded string containing only an 'assetID'.

deletePropertiesFromAssetAirline.description: Delete one or more properties from an asset's state. Argument is a JSON encoded string containing an 'assetID' and an array of qualified property names. For example, in an event object containing common and custom properties objects, the argument might look like {'assetID':'A1',['common.location', 'custom.carrier', 'custom.temperature']} and the result of that invoke would be the removal of the location, carrier and temperature properties. The missing temperature would clear a 'OVERTEMP' alert when the rules engine runs.

deletePropertiesFromAssetAircraft.description: Delete one or more properties from an asset's state. Argument is a JSON encoded string containing an 'assetID' and an array of qualified property names. For example, in an event object containing common and custom properties objects, the argument might look like {'assetID':'A1',['common.location', 'custom.carrier', 'custom.temperature']} and the result of that invoke would be the removal of the location, carrier and temperature properties. The missing temperature would clear a 'OVERTEMP' alert when the rules engine runs.

deletePropertiesFromAssetAssembly.description: Delete one or more properties from an asset's state. Argument is a JSON encoded string containing an 'assetID' and an array of qualified property names. For example, in an event object containing common and custom properties objects, the argument might look like {'assetID':'A1',['common.location', 'custom.carrier', 'custom.temperature']} and the result of that invoke would be the removal of the location, carrier and temperature properties. The missing temperature would clear a 'OVERTEMP' alert when the rules engine runs.

deleteAllAssetsAirline.description: Delete the state of all assets. No arguments are accepted. For each managed asset, the state and history are erased, and the asset is removed if necessary from recent states.

deleteAllAssetsAircraft.description: Delete the state of all assets. No arguments are accepted. For each managed asset, the state and history are erased, and the asset is removed if necessary from recent states.

deleteAllAssetsAssembly.description: Delete the state of all assets. No arguments are accepted. For each managed asset, the state and history are erased, and the asset is removed if necessary from recent states.

readAssetAirline.description: Returns the state of an airline asset. Argument is a JSON encoded string. The arg is an 'assetID' property.

readAssetAircraft.description: Returns the state of an aircraft asset. Argument is a JSON encoded string. The arg is an 'assetID' property.

readAssetAssembly.description: Returns the state of an assembly asset. Argument is a JSON encoded string. The arg is an 'assetID' property.

readAllAssetsAirline.description: Returns the state of all airline assets as an array of JSON encoded strings. Accepts no arguments. For each managed asset, the state is read from the ledger and added to the returned array. Array is sorted by 'assetID'.

args.description: accepts one optional argument, a filter

readAllAssetsAircraft.description: Returns the state of all aircraft assets as an array of JSON encoded strings. Accepts no arguments. For each managed asset, the state is read from the ledger and added to the returned array. Array is sorted by 'assetID'.

args.description: accepts one optional argument, a filter

readAllAssetsAssembly.description: Returns the state of all assembly assets as an array of JSON encoded strings. Accepts no arguments. For each managed asset, the state is read from the ledger and added to the returned array. Array is sorted by 'assetID'.

args.description: accepts one optional argument, a filter

readAssetAirlineHistory.description: Requests a specified number of history states for airline assets. Returns an array of states sorted with the most recent first. The 'assetID' property is required and the count property is optional. A missing count, a count of zero, or too large a count returns all existing history states.

readAssetAircraftHistory.description: Requests a specified number of history states for aircraft assets. Returns an array of states sorted with the most recent first. The 'assetID' property is required and the count property is optional. A missing count, a count of zero, or too large a count returns all existing history states.

readAssetAssemblyHistory.description: Requests a specified number of history states for assembly assets. Returns an array of states sorted with the most recent first. The 'assetID' property is required and the count property is optional. A missing count, a count of zero, or too large a count returns all existing history states.

readAssetSchemas.description: Returns a string generated from the schema that contains APIs and Objects as specified in the file 'generate.json' in the /scripts folder.

result.description: JSON encoded object containing selected schemas

readAssetSamples.description: Returns a string generated from the schema that contains sample Objects as specified in the file 'generate.json' in the /scripts folder.

result.description: JSON encoded object containing selected sample data

readRecentStates.description: Returns the state of recently updated assets as an array of objects sorted with the most recently updated asset first. Each asset appears exactly once up to a maxmum of 20 in this version of the contract.

readContractState.description: Returns the state of the contract, which includes its version, its nickname and a list of 'assetID's that are currently managed.

readContractConfig.description: Returns the contract's dynamic configuration -- those thresholds and values that can be set by external applications.

updateContractConfig.description: Update the dynamic configuration for the contract. These can include thresholds and other values.

setLoggingLevel.description: Sets the logging level in the contract.

items.description: A logging level for the fabric.

setCreateOnUpdate.description: Allow updateAsset to redirect to createAsset when 'assetID' does not exist.

items.description: True to redirect on missing asset to create.

jsonrpc.description: A string specifying the version of the JSON-RPC protocol. Must be exactly '2.0'.

result.description: The value of this element is determined by the method invoked on the server.

id.description: This number will be the same as the value of the id member in the request object.

jsonrpc.description: A string specifying the version of the JSON-RPC protocol. Must be exactly '2.0'.

error.description: A structured value specifying the code and description of the error that occurred.

id.description: This number will be the same as the value of the id member in the request object. If there was an error detecting the id in the request object (e.g. Parse error/Invalid Request), it will be null.

version.description: The version number of the current contract

nickname.description: The nickname of the current contract

assetID.description: The ID of a managed asset. The resource focal point for a smart contract.

alertName.description: These alerts signal a required inspection. Only the inspection event with an action of the same name can clear these alewrts.

alertStatus.description: Active means that the alert is in force in this state. Raised means that the alert became active as the result of the event that generated this state. Cleared means that the alert became inactive as the result of the event that generated this state.

stateFilter.description: A filter that can be used to restrict a read operation to a subset of objects that meet a criteria.

entries.description: Array of qualified propery name and value pairs.

qprop.description: A qualified property as dot separated levels terminated by a leaf node. An example would be 'common.assetID'.

items.description: The qualified name of a property. E.g. 'event.common.carrier', 'event.custom.temperature', etc.

assetIDAndPropertyArray.description: Requested 'assetID' with a list of qualified property names.

eventWithFunction.description: function and string parameter that created this state object

function.description: function that created this state object

redirectedFromFunction.description: function that originally received the event

initEvent.description: event sent to init on deployment

airline.description: The writable properties for an airline

aircraft.description: Writable properties for an aircraft. Note that assetID is the aircraft serial number.

airline.description: AssetID of airline that owns this airplane

operator.description: AssetID of operator that flies this airplane

dateOfBuild.description: Aircraft build completed / in service date

assemblies.description: *Internal prefixed* assetIDs of assemblies that are mounted on this airplane

age.description: Aircraft age, computed as today's date minus DOB

cycles.description: Total number of cycles for this aircraft

adjustedCycles.description: Cycles plus analytic adjustments for this aircraft.

assembly.description: The set of writable properties that define an assembly. Note that assetID is the assembly serial number

ataCode.description: The ATA code defining the assembly type, e.g. 32=landing gear, 32-50=steering.

assemblyEvent.description: The assembly event. Note that assetID is the assembly serial number

assemblyState.description: The set of writable properties that define an assembly's state.

aircraft.description: The assetID of the aircraft on which this assembly is mounted. Blank if removed for maintenance.

cycles.description: Lifetime cycle count for this assembly.

adjustedCycles.description: Cycles plus analytic adjustments for this assembly.

aCheckCounter.description: The total cycles since last reset. Used as a baseline against which to compare adjusted cycles based on analytic inputs.

aCheckCounterAdjusted.description: ACheckCounter plus analytic adjustments. Can be larger or smaller than aCheckCounter. Used for rule calculations.

bCheckCounter.description: The total cycles since last reset. Used as a baseline against which to compare adjusted cycles based on analytic inputs.

bCheckCounterAdjusted.description: BCheckCounter plus analytic adjustments. Can be larger or smaller than aCheckCounter. Used for rule calculations.

number.description: Part number, unique to a specific design iteration.

serialNumber.description: Part serial number, unique to an individual part.

lifeLimitUsed.description: Part life limit that has been used, including adjustments.

hardlanding.description: landing considered hard by pilot or aircraft sensor

flightEvent.description: flight event, assetID defines airplane against which the event occurred

inspection.description: indicates that an inspection has occured for this assembly

inspectionEvent.description: An inspection has been performed against a specific assembly. Will clear one or more alerts and reset their counters.

analyticAdjustment.description: An adjustment based on analytical analysis to the assembly's cycle counters, which translates to changes to life limit *used*. Positive number indicates that the assembly has used more of its life, negative number indicates that the assembly has been granted a bit more life based on conditions such as weather, landing gForces, runway roughness and so on.

analyticAdjustmentEvent.description: analytic adjustment event, assetid defines the assembly receiving the adjustment

maintenance.description: Maintenance consists of installation of an assembly onto an aircraft or uninstallation of same. When an assembly is not installed on an aircraft, it is said to be in inventory or in maintenance. Thus, there is a status on assemblies showing that.

aircraft.description: The serial number of the aircraft to / from which the assembly has been installed / uninstalled.

note.description: Maintenance note for this action. Overwritten whenever a new note property is inserted into the maintenance sub-event.

eventName.description: Defines an event that is related to an asset. The complete list is in the enum property.

assetName.description: Defines an asset that is handled by this smart contract. The complete list is in the enum property. Assets follow the 'partial state as event' pattern, which includes deep merging into the asset state when updating.

iotCommon.description: The set of common properties for any event to a contract that adheres to the IoT contract pattern 'partial state as event' for assets and that may have pure events that are *about* these assets.

timestamp.description: Optional device timestamp. Note that the contract retains the blockchain-assigned transaction UUID and timestamp, which reflect the time that the event arrived at the Hyperledger fabric. The device timestamp has meaning that is relevant to the device, asset and application context.

extension.description: Application managed array of extension properties. Opaque to contract. To be used in emergencies or for sidecar information that is not relevant to contract rule processing.

references.description: An array of external references relevant to this asset.

event.description: A set of properties that constitute a message to the contract.

state.description: A set of properties that constitute a complete asset state. Includes event properties and any other calculated properties such as compliance related alerts.

txntimestamp.description: Transaction timestamp matching that in the blockchain.

txnuuid.description: Transaction UUID matching that in the blockchain.

compliant.description: A contract-specific indication that this asset is compliant.

stateArray.description: an array of states, often for different assets

stateArrayRecentFirst.description: an array of states for one asset sorted by timestamp with the most recent entry first

aCheckThreshold.description: Cycles threshold for the aCheck inspection alert.

bCheckThreshold.description: Cycles threshold for the bCheck inspection alert.
